name: Holiday Inn Paris Auteuil

reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable and friendly
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in October last year when we celebrated our 20 years anniversary. We had taken a flight from Chamonix into Orly Airport and when I was looking at the metro directions , decided to take a cab. It was only about 30 Euros for that ride probably only 10 euro cheaper from the metro ride and worth it every penny when you have plenty of luggage.

reviews.title: Very nice, quiet and comfortable
reviews.text: The reception was really friendly and they helpful with bookings and even our shuttle to the airport even though we didnt book it through them. And we get 2 hours of complimentary wifi everynight.

reviews.title: Perfect base to explore Paris
reviews.text: The location is rather far from the city and even if you like the Paris nightlife, then this is not for you. The metro is just in front - so great and there have this wonderful bakery where we buy fresh baked croissants every morning. There's a market every Thursday or Wed ( I cant remember) and you get the feel of a French market just at your doorstep.

reviews.title: next to metro station
reviews.text: Value for money but would not recommend to those who wants the Parisien nightlife...

reviews.title: Eiffel Tower about 15 minutes by metro
reviews.text: Spent three nights here after leaving a problematic short-term apartment rental. While further from downtown than I would have liked, it more than made up for that by being affordable, clean and super comfortable. Bigger room than you traditionally get in Paris, big modern bathroom and very comfortable bed. The rest of the neighbourhood turned out to be a bonus as well - lovely affordable cafe/brasserie around the corner and several markets literally right there. Steps to the Porte St Cloud metro station. You can be downtown in 15 minutes with one change at the Roosevelt station. If you're doing Paris on a budget, this could be the spot for you.

I have avoided the HI chain since a week at their perfectly appalling Montpellier branch, but the Auteuil branch has gone a long way to restoring my opinion of them. It's not really in Auteuil, being on top of the Porte de Saint Cloud roundabout, but it's only three stops along the metro, so close enough. Being a fairly up-market and business district, there aren't too many hotels and those that are mostly either expensive or poor. At Eu135 per night, the HI isn't exactly cheap, but it's a good price for the area. The quality of the accommodations is good - the room was quiet, with free WiFi, a hot shower with plenty of hot water and a comfortable bed - and the staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good

reviews.text: I didn't try the breakfast as it seemed rather expensive at Eu15, and the bar next door (Les Fontaines, I think?) offered a convivial traditional French one for about Eu8.
reviews.title: Discovered a neat neighborhood!
Does exactly what you would expect.

reviews.text: The hotel is comfortable and clean. Simple with all the neccessities, TV, Bed,and wireless connection.The lightning is good but the placement of the bathroom mirror is too far for me. Perhaps it is for a much taller person, I am 5'2" and the mirror felt too far where I cannot have a close up look. It is not the height of the mirror, it is just the distance. There is full lenght mirror inside the room but no lighting above the mirror. The hotel is conveniently located near the metro.
reviews.title: Nearly Perfect;

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast for $15 Euro at the hotel if you want but there's a great bakery around the corner that opens daily at 6:15am. It has wonderful croisant and sandwiches...along with other goodies!!! The bread is excellent! There is also
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights in June. Chose this hotel due to Brand, proximity to Metro and proximity to Roland Garros. My husband was working so needed a business shirt dry cleaned. They offered a same day service yet when he went to collect it the next evening was told it would not be back until the NEXT evening, too late for him! Their regular laundry had let them down so they let us down. The worst part was the lack of communication - they did not advise us, we found out when he went to collect the shirt. And the appalling attitude of the receptionist who could not see why this may have been an issue. Really disappointing. The room itself is very small but modern, clean and functional. The bathroom is actually a waste of space, too large for the room. WiFi was free and functional. Breakfast was fine. If I were to go to Roland Garros again I would consider staying here but it is a long Metro ride out. Couldn't find the decent restaurants that others have spoken about BUT the bakery on the corner was DIVINE !! As usual, one poorly trained or ignorant staff member can sour the impression you are left with, and make you look elsewhere in future when it really wasn't necessary.
reviews.title: Great hotel, not so great service

reviews.text: I stayed couple of nights in Holiday-Inn Auteuil in July.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: I just wanna say it was a great, recently renovated, modern, small and comfortable hotel just slightly on the edge of Paris.
reviews.title: Very nice - clean and comfortable
pleasant stay
reviews.text: I stayed there on business on Jan 24/25. It is a small hotel without a restaurant. Rooms have all been upgraded and are comfortable with choices of pillow an add-on. Bathroom is a bit empty looking but fine . Only complaint is the lack of proper free broadband. the broadband on offer is very slow.

reviews.title: Lovely and comfortable stay
reviews.text: breakfast is a mix of English / french continental and very nice.

reviews.title: My Family Paris Vacation
reviews.text: I stayed in Room 20 which gives to a courtyard at the back. No noise whatsoever.

reviews.title: A very nice stopover in Paris
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room and very clean and the staff were friendly. The location was good and we did not have any problems getting the metro to the hotel.

reviews.title: 5 days visiting Paris - lovely hotel
reviews.text: The only down side was that free wifi was only provided for 1 day and after that they charged a fee.

aka: Holiday Inn Paris Auteuil Hotel Paris
description: The Holiday Inn Garden Court Paris Auteuil, charming hotel at the foot of Porte de Saint Cloud subway station, is the ideal place for business but also leisure stay. The Holiday Inn Garden Court Paris Auteuil indeed combines an easy access to Porte de Versailles events & Porte Maillot Congress Center, it s also very close to Parc des Princes stadium & Roland Garros courts.Finally, the Holiday Inn Garden Court Paris Auteuil offers a direct access to Paris greatest tourist attractions like Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, Trocadero, Opera House, Louvre Museum, etc Our kind reception team will be pleased to help you during your stay in Paris when organizing your transportation from & to Roissy Charles de Gaulle & Orly airports. You ll get also useful information for tours to Chateau de Versailles or Bateau Mouche cruises. High speed internet and Wifi access are available in all hotel s areas: at the bar, where you ll be warmly welcomed, and in the 47 rooms all equipped with flat screen TV s, minibar, individually controlled AC, safe, day lighted marble bathroom.
